channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023080174
item.description:
Report X-2023080174

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was loaded on the rear end of the trailer and spilled. Unloading manager called me at 4pm and said there is a hazardous spill. They already had it a red hazardous tote so I didn't see what happened however it leaked either out of the cap or out of the bottom. DescribePack: It seems to be normal looking at it however it spilled either out of the top or the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I was not down there when it happened, yet it is suggested to have it on the floor towards the rear of the trailer. Non-hazardous packages should surround it and do not stack boxes of hazardous materials on top of each other.

item.title: Report X-2023080136
item.description:
Report X-2023080136

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unload process. Unload area was shut down and trailer was pulled off the door. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Unload area was shut down and trailer was pulled off the door.

item.title: Report E-2023070954
item.description:
Report E-2023070954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 50 pound bag of caustic soda (un1823) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 pound of product . Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070943
item.description:
Report E-2023070943

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one 330 gallon metal tote of phosphoric acid (un1805) had a loose cap and had released 1 cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
